oracle.adf.view.rich.remote
Class RemoteRegionListenerContext

java.lang.Object
  oracle.adf.view.rich.remote.RemoteRegionListenerContext

public abstract class RemoteRegionListenerContext
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a context for RemoteRegionListeners so that they can extend their functionality based on a particular RemoteRegionModel. Each context is valid only for a single thread and a single call into the RemoteRegionListeners and, as such, should never be cached. The underlying objects returned from this context, however, may well be shared. One important thing to understand about this context is that it is backed by a particular RemoteRegionModel. If the RemoteRegionModel changes (in particular the set and get attributes) then the things returned from this class will likely change also. Conversely if two regions share the same model (they shouldn't) then items on this context may be shared.

public RemoteRegionListenerContext()

Method Detail

getCurrentInstance

public static RemoteRegionListenerContext getCurrentInstance()
Returns the current context for the RemoteRegion or null if the RemoteRegionListeners are not currently running in the proper context.
Returns:
the current context or null

setCurrentInstance

protected static void setCurrentInstance(RemoteRegionListenerContext context)
Sets the current instance on the threadLocal. It is assumed that if a piece of code adds a RemoteRegionListenerContext it also removes it vial the release() method below.
Parameters:
context - the context to set, this cannot be null

getModel

public abstract RemoteRegionModel getModel()
Returns the current RemoteRegionModel. This object represents the Model of the component that the listener is currently being executed for.
Returns:

getClientId

public abstract java.lang.String getClientId()
Get the current Region's client id
Returns:

getRegionSpecificRequestMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getRegionSpecificRequestMap()
This returns a map which resides on the current Request for this particular model. For each request, each individual RemoteRegionModel will have its own version of this map and it is ideal for storing persistant state between RemoteRegionListener calls.

release

public void release()
Released the stored context
